Article Title: Putin and Xi to meet in Beijing in October, Russia says
Description: MOSCOW: Russian President Vladimir Putin will travel to Beijing in October for talks with China's Xi Jinping, the Kremlin's chief's first known trip abroad since the International Criminal Court (ICC) issued an arrest warrant against him.

Article Title: Climate change, conflict made Libya deluge more likely: Study
Description: PARIS: Climate change made torrential rains that triggered deadly flooding in Libya up to 50 times more likely, new research said on Tuesday (Sep 19), noting that conflict and poor dam maintenance turned extreme weather into a humanitarian disaster.

Article Title: China files appeal against WTO panel report on US steel, aluminium tariffs
Description: BEIJING: China has filed an appeal against a World Trade Organization panel report that recognised the US' actions on steel and aluminium as security measures, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Article Title: UK says no evidence of political bank account closures
Description: LONDON: Britain on Tuesday (Sep 19) said it found no evidence of "political" bank account closures, according to a review launched after the controversial withdrawal of facilities for Nigel Farage, angering the arch Brexiteer.

Article Title: Philippines activists freed after alleged military abduction
Description: MANILA: Two environmental activists allegedly abducted by the Philippine military more than two weeks ago were freed Tuesday (Sep 19), sparking jubilation among supporters who had campaigned for their release.

Article Title: India will receive heavy monsoon rains in September, says weather chief
Description: NEW DELHI: India will receive heavy monsoon rains at the tail end of the four-month season, the chief of the weather office said on Tuesday (Sep 19), bringing farmers succour after the driest August in more than a century hit some summer crops.

Article Title: Strained ties between India, Canada hit 'new low' after accusation of Sikh leader's murder
Description: Accusations linking the Indian government to the killing of a Sikh separatist leader on Canadian soil have dealt a blow to diplomatic ties between Canada and India, but the tensions have been simmering for some time, said observers on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Article Title: Taiwan's TSMC to help train German students for semiconductor careers
Description: TAICHUNG: Germany's Saxony state signed an agreement with Taiwanese chip giant TSMC on Tuesday (Sep 19) to train German students in an effort to meet the growing demand for workers in the semiconductor sector.

Article Title: Strained ties between India, Canada hit 'new low' after accusation of Sikh leader's murder
Description: Accusations linking the Indian government to the killing of a Sikh separatist leader on Canadian soil have dealt a blow to diplomatic ties between Canada and India, but the tensions have been simmering for some time, said observers on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Article Title: What to know about the Sikh movement at the centre of tensions between India and Canada
Description: NEW DELHI: Tensions between Canada and India have reached new heights with dueling diplomatic expulsions and an allegation of Indian government involvement in the killing of a Sikh activist on Canadian soil.

Article Title: China's ex-foreign minister Qin Gang was ousted after alleged affair: Report
Description: China's former foreign minister Qin Gang, who was ousted from his position in July, had an extramarital affair while he was ambassador to the United States, the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday (Sep 19), citing people familiar with a briefing.

Article Title: Rice farmers rejoicing but consumers frowning in Thailand amid global price spikes and shortages
Thai ex-PM Thaksin had surgery last week, daughter says
Description: BANGKOK: Jailed former Thai prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra underwent surgery last week, his daughter said Tuesday (Sep 19), as his family mulls seeking his release on parole.

Article Title: Dermal fillers and blindness: What causes it? Can it be reversed? What are the signs that something is wrong?
Description: What most people want out of dermal fillers is a fresher, more youthful mien – minus the need to go under the knife. A few strategically placed and minute injections of the gel-like substance under the skin may reduce the appearance of wrinkles, lift droopy eyelids and plump up facial volume loss caused by ageing.

Article Title: Thai king's son urges open discussion of royal insult law
Description: BANGKOK: The Thai king's son has called for open discussion of the country's tough laws against insulting the royal family, a sensitive topic that has seen hundreds of people prosecuted in recent years.

Article Title: Blindness caused by 'inadvertent' injection of dermal filler into bloodstream; product is safe, says distributor
Description: SINGAPORE: It was the procedure, not the product, that caused a woman to go blind after receiving dermal fillers during aesthetic treatment, the product's distributor said on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Article Title: Man who killed 2-year-old daughter, left charred remains in pot gets over 21 years’ jail, caning
Description: SINGAPORE: A man who killed his toddler and hid the crime with his wife by burning the girl's body in a metal pot was sentenced to 21-and-a-half years in jail and 18 strokes of the cane on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Article Title: CNA Explains: Why do airlines offload luggage when faced with adverse weather conditions?
Description: SINGAPORE: Some passengers travelling on board Scoot flight TR134 from Singapore to Xi'an last week arrived in the Chinese city without their luggage.

Article Title: US finds debris from missing F-35
Description: WASHINGTON: Debris from a stealth jet that went missing after the pilot ejected has been found, the US military said on Monday (Sep 18), after a day in which failure to track the US$80 million aircraft drew amazement and ridicule in equal measure.

Article Title: ASEAN kicks off its first-ever joint military drills in Indonesia
Description: BATAM, Indonesia: Units from the countries of ASEAN began their first-ever joint military drills in Indonesia's South Natuna Sea amid rising geopolitical tensions between major powers and protests against China's activities in the South China Sea.

Article Title: Graft accusations dog top Zelenskyy aides
Description: VIENNA/KYIV: In his years as the chief executive of one of Ukraine's biggest construction firms, Oleh Maiboroda kept rolls of dollar bills in a safe behind his desk.

Article Title: Commentary: What one more dash in the South China Sea tells us about China’s game
Description: SINGAPORE: Recent events in Asia might seem unsettling. Beijing released a new “standard map” that featured a 10-dash line claim to the South China Sea; Chinese President Xi Jinping snubbed the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) summit in Jakarta; and China and Philippines had yet another confrontation at the contested Second Thomas Shoal.

Article Title: Musk says X could charge all users 'small monthly payment'
Description: Online platform X could introduce a monthly fee for all users, its owner Elon Musk said on Monday (Sep 18), citing the need to cut down on bots.

Article Title: Starbucks opens US$220 million plant outside Shanghai
Description: SHANGHAI: US coffee behemoth Starbucks opened a US$220 million development outside Shanghai on Tuesday (Sep 19), a sign that established multinationals are still looking to China for growth despite its faltering post-COVID recovery.

Article Title: Fewer 'I dos' ruin the party for China's US$500 billion wedding industry
Description: SHANGHAI: COVID-19 wasn't kind to wedding planners in China, where marriages are traditionally elaborate, expensive affairs, but the industry estimated at almost US$500 billion is now facing a bigger threat: A plunge in the number of couples willing to tie the knot.

Article Title: International support crucial as Ukraine continues counteroffensive in drawn-out war: Observers
Description: As Ukraine pushes on with a gruelling counteroffensive to recapture territory more than 18 months after Russia’s invasion, observers say international support is crucial to sustaining Kyiv’s resistance and momentum.

Article Title: India will receive heavy monsoon rains in September, says weather chief
Description: NEW DELHI: India will receive heavy monsoon rains at the tail end of the four-month season, the chief of the weather office said on Tuesday (Sep 19), bringing farmers succour after the driest August in more than a century hit some summer crops.

Article Title: How Hong Kong became a fencing powerhouse and cheered up a city
Description: HONG KONG: Hong Kong is one of the smaller Asian Games teams by population, but when it comes to fencing the city is a regional heavyweight with ambitious medal hopes.

Article Title: Thailand records 19 million foreign tourists so far this year
Description: BANGKOK: Thailand recorded 19 million foreign tourists in the January to Sep 17 period this year, the tourism ministry said on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Article Title: Oyster farmers in Australia expand into tourism, offer in-water dining experience to keep industry alive
Description: HAWKESBURY RIVER, New South Wales: Oyster farmers in the Hawkesbury River in New South Wales have expanded into tourism to keep their industry alive.

Article Title: Climate change, conflict made Libya deluge more likely: Study
Description: PARIS: Climate change made torrential rains that triggered deadly flooding in Libya up to 50 times more likely, new research said on Tuesday (Sep 19), noting that conflict and poor dam maintenance turned extreme weather into a humanitarian disaster.

Article Title: Oyster farmers in Australia expand into tourism to keep industry alive | Video
Sydney issues total fire bans as spring heatwave grips Australia
Description: SYDNEY: An intense spring heat wave sweeping across Australia's south-east raised the risks of bushfires, prompting authorities on Tuesday (Sep 19) to issue the first total fire ban in nearly three years for Sydney and shut down several schools.

Article Title: In New York, Biden says he is running for re-election because democracy is at stake
Description: NEW YORK: US President Joe Biden, who is raising cash for his re-election campaign while visiting New York for meetings with world leaders, acknowledged concerns about his age on Monday (Sep 18) but said he was running because democracy was still at stake.

Article Title: Ukraine says punctured Russian defence lines as Zelenskyy arrives in New York
Description: KYIV: Kyiv said on Monday (Sep 18) its forces had broken through Russia's defensive lines near the war-battered town of Bakhmut in the slow-moving but high-stakes Ukrainian counteroffensive, ahead of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy addressing the UN General Assembly.

Article Title: SingPost increases postage rate for standard regular mail by 65% amid rising costs
Description: SINGAPORE: Singapore Post (SingPost) will increase the postage rate for standard regular mail from 31 cents to 51 cents – an almost 65 per cent increase – amid rising costs and declining mail volume.

Article Title: Former SkillsFuture chief executive Ong Tze-Ch’in to take over as chief executive of PUB
Description: SINGAPORE: A new chief executive will take charge of the national water agency PUB, less than one year and four months after the appointment of the incumbent.

Article Title: Public transport fare hike is small compared to the increase in operating costs, analysts say
Description: SINGAPORE: The public transport fare hike should be viewed in the context of even higher operating costs, analysts said, following the Public Transport Council’s (PTC) latest fare review exercise.

Article Title: Public transport fare hike: Adults to pay 10 to 11 cents more per journey from Dec 23
Description: SINGAPORE: The latest bus and train fare increases will more than double from last year's hike, which means adult commuters will pay 10 to 11 cents more per journey, the Public Transport Council (PTC) said on Monday (Sep 18).

Article Title: Home Team officers disciplined in 131 cases of workplace discrimination over last 5 years
Description: SINGAPORE: The Home Team departments and the Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) headquarters have investigated 310 cases of workplace discrimination in the last five years, Law and Home Affairs Minister K Shanmugam said on Monday (Sep 18).

Article Title: NUS academic 'truly sorry' for 'flawed and biased' article on recent political controversies, retracts it from website
Description: SINGAPORE: Dr Chan Ying-Kit, who wrote an article for East Asia Forum, an Australia-based academic website that was issued with a correction direction from a Singapore government agency on Sep 13, has apologised for the distress it has caused.

Article Title: Commentary: Being an only child doesn’t affect your development - family background matters more
Description: LONDON: Being an only child is a “disease in itself”, according to 19th century psychologist Stanley G Hall. Even though Hall’s views and scholarly research methods have been questioned and criticised, only children’s reputation as spoiled, overprotected and lonely has persisted ever since.

Article Title: Commentary: TikTok influencers peddle ‘lazy girl jobs’, but there’s no such thing as a high-paying, low-stress job
Description: SINGAPORE: In between bites of a sandwich you ordered to the office, you leisurely type out emails and pick up the occasional call. You decide to take a midday break to scroll through your YouTube feed.

Article Title: Commentary: Going on holiday will look very different because of climate change
Description: GLASGOW: Holidays are making a comeback after several years of disruption caused by the COVID-19 pandemic. Nearly 4 billion passengers boarded international flights in 2022, up from fewer than 2 billion in 2020. Recent research suggests that people are likely to continue travelling more in 2023 and beyond.

Article Title: Commentary: Should we be worried about mandarin ducks and parakeets squeezing out Singapore’s native birds?
Description: SINGAPORE: When asked about the birds in Singapore, most people would probably have a list of nuisances they “need” to live with, from noisy chickens and infamous “uwu” birds (the Asian koel) to pesky pigeons and mynas stalking hawker centres.

Article Title: Commentary: China is so far ahead in the EV market it’s a warning for Europe
Description: LONDON: At an event last week, a businessman suddenly pulled out his phone to show me his experience in a driverless taxi in downtown Beijing. In the video, a robotaxi impressively navigated a turn across several lanes of a busy road.

Article Title: Commentary: 'This desk is mine' - how noisy offices can make us more territorial
Description: BRISBANE: From colleagues chatting about their weekends or having intense phone conversations, to email alerts and loud tapping on keyboards, the evidence that open-plan offices take a toll on our well-being continues to mount. There’s a clear relationship between noise levels and physiological signs of stress such as heart rate.

Article Title: Google announces new Bard features as traffic continues to lag ChatGPT
Description: Alphabet's Google said on Tuesday (Sep 19) that Bard, its generative artificial intelligence, will have the ability to fact-check its answers and analyse users' personal Google data as the tech giant scrambles to catch up to ChatGPT in popularity.

Article Title: Hitachi seeks EU okay for Thales deal with asset sales in France, Germany
Description: BRUSSELS: Hitachi has offered to sell assets in France and Germany in a bid to address EU antitrust concerns about its proposed €1.7 billion (US$1.8 billion) buy of Thales' GTS railway signalling business, a Hitachi spokesperson said on Monday (Sep 18).

Article Title: Israeli PM Netanyahu urges Musk to fight anti-Semitism
Description: WASHINGTON: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Monday (Sep 18) urged Elon Musk to fight anti-Semitism on his X platform as he sat down with the tech tycoon to discuss artificial intelligence.

Article Title: Portugal's telecom watchdog working with operators to bar Huawei
Description: LISBON: Portugal's telecom watchdog said on Monday (Sep 18) it is working with operators to implement a high-level resolution which effectively bars Huawei's equipment from the country's 5G mobile networks, despite legal objections from the Chinese company.

Article Title: Hyundai Motor's South Korea union accepts 12% wage hike deal
Description: SEOUL: Hyundai Motor Co and a union representing its South Korean workforce on Monday (Sep 18) sealed a wage deal that will boost annual pay by about 12 per cent, avoiding a strike and production losses at the company's biggest manufacturing base.

Article Title: Arm Holdings options draw robust trading volume as shares slide
Description: NEW YORK: Options on the newly listed shares of SoftBank's Arm Holdings, the year's biggest initial public offering, started trading on Monday, at a brisk pace, as a drop in the share price prompted investors to take guard.

Article Title: Dermal fillers and blindness: What causes it? Can it be reversed? What are the signs that something is wrong?
Description: What most people want out of dermal fillers is a fresher, more youthful mien – minus the need to go under the knife. A few strategically placed and minute injections of the gel-like substance under the skin may reduce the appearance of wrinkles, lift droopy eyelids and plump up facial volume loss caused by ageing.

Article Title: New restaurant Bacata explores Colombian food and what it has in common with nasi lemak
Description: Chef Fernando Arevalo readily acknowledges that the impression most people have of his native Colombia doesn’t go very far beyond coffee, Netflix drug lords and Shakira. And yet, the 38-year-old, who’s called Singapore home for the past 10 years, has opened a restaurant serving modern Colombian cuisine.

Article Title: At this private island resort in the Maldives, it’s hard to get away
Description: During the worst of the pandemic, while the rest of us sheltered in place at home, a handful of the world’s wealthiest individuals sought refuge on one delicious slice of paradise. On this opalescent island hidden away in the middle of the Indian Ocean, the privileged few shared space with little else but hermit crabs who spend all day scrambling drunkenly across blonde sands.

Article Title: Spain players reiterate strike intention despite national call-up
Description: BARCELONA: Striking Spanish internationals called up to the women's team reiterated their desire not to form part of the squad in a new blow for the shaken Spanish football federation (RFEF).

Article Title: Spanish court throws out Rubiales' pre-kiss defamation lawsuit
Description: MADRID: A Spanish court has dismissed a lawsuit by disgraced ex-soccer federation chief Luis Rubiales against coach Javier Clemente who had called Rubiales a "dangerous and ambitious guy" seeking "to get rich", qualifying his comments as free speech.

Article Title: Iranians give Ronaldo rapturous welcome in Tehran
Description: TEHRAN: Crowds of Iranian football fans gave Cristiano Ronaldo an excited welcome on Monday (Sep 18) as his Saudi team arrived in Tehran for the first home-and-away club tie since the two countries resumed diplomatic relations.

Article Title: Putin and Xi to meet in Beijing in October, Russia says
Description: MOSCOW: Russian President Vladimir Putin will travel to Beijing in October for talks with China's Xi Jinping, the Kremlin's chief's first known trip abroad since the International Criminal Court (ICC) issued an arrest warrant against him.

Article Title: Climate change, conflict made Libya deluge more likely: Study
Description: PARIS: Climate change made torrential rains that triggered deadly flooding in Libya up to 50 times more likely, new research said on Tuesday (Sep 19), noting that conflict and poor dam maintenance turned extreme weather into a humanitarian disaster.

Description: BEIJING: China has filed an appeal against a World Trade Organization panel report that recognised the US' actions on steel and aluminium as security measures, the Chinese commerce ministry said on Tuesday (Sep 19).

Description: LONDON: Britain on Tuesday (Sep 19) said it found no evidence of "political" bank account closures, according to a review launched after the controversial withdrawal of facilities for Nigel Farage, angering the arch Brexiteer.

Description: MANILA: Two environmental activists allegedly abducted by the Philippine military more than two weeks ago were freed Tuesday (Sep 19), sparking jubilation among supporters who had campaigned for their release.
